BR_text.BRdescription:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
 
 When attempting to run Plotly treemap charts in Streamlit they don't render. This seems to be a bug in Streamlit's JS side. Potentially our Plotly JS library isn't running the same version of Plotly as the Python library.
 <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
 
 What are the steps we should take to reproduce the bug:
 
 Attempt to run any Plotly treemap chart within Streamlit.
 Plotly treemap charts can be found here: https://plot.ly/python/treemaps/
 
 <denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
 
 Being able to use Plotly's interactive treemap charts within Streamlit.
 <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
 
 The treemap doesn't render or if fig.show() is used the treemap renders in a separate tab.
 <denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
 
 no
 <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
 
 
 Streamlit version: 0.49.0
 Python version: 2.7.10
 Using PipEnv
 OS version: mac0S Mojave version 10.14
 Browser version: Brave 0.68.132
 
 <denchmark-h:h1>Additional information</denchmark-h>
 
 Link to code: <denchmark-link:https://jsfiddle.net/mqvr2awe/1/>https://jsfiddle.net/mqvr2awe/1/</denchmark-link>
